Ministers and people should act nobly and liberally in dealing with our publishing houses. Instead of studying and contriving 
                                                                           11
how they can obtain periodicals, tracts, and books at the lowest figure, they should seek to bring the minds of the people to see the true value of the publications. All these pennies taken from thousands of publications have caused a loss of thousands of dollars to the Office, when to each individual a few pennies more would scarcely have been felt.
